page.title: 17TEIGNMOUTH RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Teignmouth railway station is on the Paddington to Penzance main line. There are two platforms in use. Nine people work at the station. They include office workers, signal box operators and staff to deal with trains, tickets and telephones. The trains provide a service to local towns, including Dawlish, Newton Abbot and Torquay. Inter-city trains go to London, Wales, the Midlands and the North. The price of a single ticket from Teignmouth to London is Â£21.40. From Teignmouth to Exeter it would cost Â£1.80. Eighteen people were interviewed at the station about their use of the station that day. Five were travelling to local towns, while only four people were travelling for business purposes. All those interviewed travelled second class.
